scenario:
Dr. Bernice A. King, CEO of The King Center, announced a schedule of programs and events for the 2025 King Holiday Observance, commemorating what would have been Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s 96th birthday. The events took place from January 7th to January 20th, 2025, and included a Kick-Off Reception and Book Signing, Nonviolence365 Training, Beloved Community Global Summit, and the Martin Luther King, Jr. Beloved Community Commemorative Service.

Key events included:

- A Kick-Off Reception and Book Signing on January 8th, featuring Dr. Angela Farris Watkins signing her book 'Love Will See You Through' and 'My Uncle Martin's Words for America'.
- A virtual interactive lunch and learn on January 13th, highlighting the enduring relevance of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s principles in today's world.
- A Beloved Community Teach-In on January 13th, inviting educational institutions to educate students about Dr. and Mrs. King's legacy and champion their unfinished work of creating the Beloved Community.
- A Beloved Community Youth Book Reading on January 14th, featuring the book 'It Starts with Me!' written and illustrated by Dr. Bernice A. King and Dr. Kimberly P. Johnson.
- A Beloved Community Global Summit on January 15th, exploring the transformative intersection of artificial intelligence (AI) with freedom, justice, and democracy, guided by the ethos of Nonviolence365.
- A Beloved Community Youth Global Summit on January 16th, designed to inspire, educate, and empower young people to understand and engage with artificial intelligence.
- The MLK, Jr. Beloved Community Awards on January 11th, honoring national and international individuals and organizations that exemplify excellence in leadership, unwavering commitment to social justice, and a dedication to fostering the Beloved Community.
- The 2025 Martin Luther King, Jr. Beloved Community Commemorative Service on January 20th, featuring special musical performances and a keynote speaker.

The King Center's partners included Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park, Ebenezer Baptist Church, AmeriCorps, and the City of Atlanta - Department of Technology and Innovation. Sponsors included Delta Air Lines, Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, Kia, Mars, Inc., and Target Corporation.

The King Center is a 501(c) (3) organization established in 1968 by Mrs. Coretta Scott King, committed to educating the world on the life, legacy, and teachings of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. The King Center serves to inspire new generations to carry forward his unfinished work, strengthen causes, and empower change-makers who are continuing his efforts today.
